availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Jacyntha Womack. Father of Martha A. Womack, Archibald Womack, Egbert Womack, James Womack, Sarah Womack, Ephraim Womack, William Womack, and Richard Womack. Farmer in Carter County in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as a private from December 31, 1861 to September 8, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2 p. 218A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 220.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 4, p. 82B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 858.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 269.
